issue.title: File Download is not successfull with quic and ipv6
issue.body:
Hi Team,

I built H2O server in my ubuntu machine by using below steps.
(https://h2o.examp1e.net/install.html)

after i tried to download file using curl from h2o server using quic.

with http3(ipv4) file download if fine but when i tried with ipv6 over http3 handshake itself not sucessfull.

IPv4 over quic

```
root@ubuntu:/tmp# curl -v -k --http3-only -# -o /tmp/BPS.pdf https://127.0.0.1:7443/BPS.pdf
*   Trying 127.0.0.1:7443...
* QUIC cipher selection: TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256:TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384:TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256:TLS_AES_128_CCM_SHA256
* Skipped certificate verification
* Connected to 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1) port 7443
* using HTTP/3
* [HTTP/3] [0] OPENED stream for https://127.0.0.1:7443/BPS.pdf
* [HTTP/3] [0] [:method: GET]
* [HTTP/3] [0] [:scheme: https]
* [HTTP/3] [0] [:authority: 127.0.0.1:7443]
* [HTTP/3] [0] [:path: /BPS.pdf]
* [HTTP/3] [0] [user-agent: curl/8.4.1-DEV]
* [HTTP/3] [0] [accept: */*]
> GET /BPS.pdf HTTP/3
> Host: 127.0.0.1:7443
> User-Agent: curl/8.4.1-DEV
> Accept: */*
>
< HTTP/3 200
< server: h2o/2.3.0-DEV@6cd46e08c
< content-length: 30182355
< date: Fri, 20 Oct 2023 09:29:21 GMT
< content-type: application/pdf
< last-modified: Mon, 16 Oct 2023 14:36:01 GMT
< etag: "652d4a51-1cc8bd3"
< accept-ranges: bytes
< alt-svc: h3-25=":7443"
<
{ [17182 bytes data]
################################################################################################################################ 100.0%* Connection #0 to host 127.0.0.1 left intact
```

IPv6 over quic

```
root@ubuntu:/tmp# curl -v -k --http3-only -# -o /tmp/BPS.pdf https://[::1]:7443/BPS.pdf
*   Trying [::1]:7443...
* QUIC cipher selection: TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256:TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384:TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256:TLS_AES_128_CCM_SHA256
* ngtcp2_conn_handle_expiry returned error: ERR_HANDSHAKE_TIMEOUT
* Failed to connect to ::1 port 7443 after 10002 ms: Failed sending data to the peer
* Closing connection     #        #
curl: (55) ngtcp2_conn_handle_expiry returned error: ERR_HANDSHAKE_TIMEOUT

root@ubuntu:/tmp#
```

Below is my h2o version

```
root@ubuntu:/tmp# /usr/local/bin/h2o --version
h2o version 2.3.0-DEV@6cd46e08c
OpenSSL: OpenSSL 3.0.2 15 Mar 2022
capabilities: YES
fusion: YES
ssl-zerocopy: YES
ktls: YES
root@ubuntu:/tmp#
```

Below is my port opened

```
root@ubuntu:/tmp# netstat -alpn | grep 7443
tcp        0      0 0.0.0.0:7443            0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN      191348/perl
tcp6       0      0 :::7443                 :::*                    LISTEN      191348/perl
udp        0      0 0.0.0.0:7443            0.0.0.0:*                           191348/perl
udp6       0      0 :::7443                 :::*                                191348/perl
root@ubuntu:/tmp#
```

Below is my h2o config,

```
root@ubuntu:/tmp# cat /root/h2o/examples/h2o/h2o.conf
http3-graceful-shutdown-timeout: 0
http3-gso: ON
http3-input-window-size: 19777216
http3-idle-timeout: 50
send-server-name: ON
neverbleed-offload: QAT-AUTO
ssl-offload: kernel
throttle-response: ON

header.set: "Alt-Svc: h3-25=\":7443\""
hosts:
  "localhost:7443":
    listen: 8080
    listen: &ssl_listen
      port: 7443
      ssl:
        certificate-file: /home/vagrant/quic_services/openssl/example.crt
        key-file: /home/vagrant/quic_services/openssl/example.key
        minimum-version: TLSv1.2
        cipher-preference: server
        cipher-suite: "ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDHE-ECDSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305:ECDHE-RSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA384:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA256"
        # Oldest compatible clients: Firefox 27, Chrome 30, IE 11 on Windows 7, Edge, Opera 17, Safari 9, Android 5.0, and Java 8
        # see: https://wiki.mozilla.org/Security/Server_Side_TLS
    # The following three lines enable HTTP/3
    listen:
      <<: *ssl_listen
      quic:
        retry: ON
        handshake-timeout-rtt-multiplier: 900
        max-initial-handshake-packets: 1500
        max-streams-bidi: 200
        max-udp-payload-size: 1942
        qpack-encoder-table-capacity: 8096
    paths:
      /:
        file.dir: /var/www/html/

user: root
access-log: /root/h2o/access.log
error-log: /root/h2o/error.log
pid-file: /root/h2o/pid.txt
root@ubuntu:/tmp#
```

Curl -V

```
root@ubuntu:/tmp# curl -V
curl 8.4.1-DEV (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/8.4.1-DEV OpenSSL/3.0.10 zlib/1.2.11 brotli/1.0.9 nghttp2/1.58.0-DEV ngtcp2/0.19.1 nghttp3/0.15.0
Release-Date: [unreleased]
Protocols: dict file ftp ftps gopher gophers http https imap imaps mqtt pop3 pop3s rtsp smb smbs smtp smtps telnet tftp
Features: alt-svc AsynchDNS brotli HSTS HTTP2 HTTP3 HTTPS-proxy IPv6 Largefile libz NTLM SSL threadsafe TLS-SRP UnixSockets
root@ubuntu:/tmp#

```

uname -a

```
root@ubuntu:/tmp# uname -a
Linux ubuntu 5.15.0-60-generic #66-Ubuntu SMP Fri Jan 20 14:29:49 UTC 2023 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
root@ubuntu:/tmp#
```

OS-Version

```
root@ubuntu:/tmp# cat /etc/os-release
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS"
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION_ID="22.04"
VERSION="22.04.3 LTS (Jammy Jellyfish)"
VERSION_CODENAME=jammy
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
HOME_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/"
SUPPORT_URL="https://help.ubuntu.com/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/"
PRIVACY_POLICY_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/legal/terms-and-policies/privacy-policy"
UBUNTU_CODENAME=jammy
root@ubuntu:/tmp#
```

Could you please confirm is this a issue or am i missing anything in the configuration,

pull_request.title: [ipv6] fix address token validation failures
pull_request.body:
Builds on top of https://github.com/h2o/quicly/pull/563.

As reported in #3298, h2o fails to accept HTTP/3 connections when it it configured to send Retries (i.e., when having `retry: ON` in the configuration file).

This PR fixes the issue. For more information, please refer to the quicly PR.

Closes #3298.

comment.body:
@Karthikdasari0423 Hey, we think the bug will be fixed once we incorporate the changes proposed in #3299. Would you mind trying?

This issue was related to address tokens - HTTP/3 on IPv6 was broken when `retry: on` was set.

pull_request.title: [ipv6] fix address token validation failures
pull_request.body:
Builds on top of https://github.com/h2o/quicly/pull/563.

As reported in #3298, h2o fails to accept HTTP/3 connections when it it configured to send Retries (i.e., when having `retry: ON` in the configuration file).

This PR fixes the issue. For more information, please refer to the quicly PR.

Closes #3298.

issue.title: Uploads hang  (~16 Mo or ~22s), no data transmitted to "proxy.reverse.url"
issue.body:
Hello!

The issue is 100% reproductible on my setup so if you need more info, please tell me.

When uploading a file (to WordPress or PhpMyAdmin), h2o stops reading data after ~15/16 MB or after ~22s.

ssldump can't decrypt public trafic because RSA is not used.
tcpdump shows that no data is transfered to Apache (proxy.reverse.url).

h2o receives data from the browser, buffers it and then it stops.

No errors (either HTTP or in log files), no TCP reset, no HTTP Headers sent to proxy (ie: POST), nothing: it just hangs.

I have double-check Apache and PHP config files, everything seems fine but it does not matter because no data is transmitted to Apache.

Have a great day. :)

# ---

Browser -> Internet -> H2O (public IP) -> proxy.reverse.url -> Apache (internal IP)

h2o was compiled last night using commit [7e99771](https://github.com/h2o/h2o/tree/7e9977136b90b22f4a0607b89b93bdc50bbdf952).

- limit-request-body (undefined so 1 GB)
- handshake-timeout: 10
- temp-buffer-threshold: 100663296 (96 MB)
- http1-request-timeout: 30
- http2-idle-timeout: 30
- http2-graceful-shutdown-timeout: 30
- proxy.timeout.first_byte: 900000 (I know, this is insane...)
- proxy.timeout.keepalive: 30000
- proxy.reverse.url: "http://10.31.0.8:80/"

```dockerfile
    echo '        file.custom-handler:' >> /etc/h2o/h2o.conf && \
    echo '          extension: .php' >> /etc/h2o/h2o.conf && \
    echo '          fastcgi.spawn: "PHP_FCGI_CHILDREN=2 exec /usr/bin/php-cgi"' >> /etc/h2o/h2o.conf && \
    h2o -t -c /etc/h2o/h2o.conf

CMD ["/usr/local/bin/h2o", "-c", "/etc/h2o/h2o.conf"]
EXPOSE 443
```
</details>
<details>
<summary>Runner</summary>

```sh
#!/bin/bash

set -ue

LOCAL_PORT=43975

# Build docker image
sudo docker build -t h2o-http2-large-file-test .

# Run docker container
sudo docker kill h2o-http2-large-file-test-1 || true
sudo docker run -d --rm -p $LOCAL_PORT:443 --name h2o-http2-large-file-test-1 -t h2o-http2-large-file-test

# Create 100MB dummy file
dd if=/dev/zero of=100mb.dat bs=1M count=100

# Upload 100MB dummy file (HTTP/1.1)
curl -v --insecure --http1.1 -X POST -F file=@100mb.dat https://localhost:$LOCAL_PORT/

# Upload 100MB dummy file (HTTP/2); HUNG UP AFTER 16MiB PROCESSED
curl -v --insecure --http2 -X POST -F file=@100mb.dat https://localhost:$LOCAL_PORT/

echo "OK"
```
</details>

When creating an application for uploading files using H2O (HTTP/2), it cannot handle files larger than approximately 16 MiB. This is a highly undesirable situation for the H2O server.

payload.description: H2O - the optimized HTTP/1, HTTP/2, HTTP/3 server

issue.title: File Download is not successfull with quic and ipv6
